newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady.

text.p: U.S. millfeed prices were mostly steady on Wednesday amid featureless activity, dealers said.
One dealer said the market was watching the direction of Chicago Board of Trade corn prices. But for the most part, trading was subdued, dealers said.
"I think we have got fairly quiet demand which is normal," one Buffalo dealer said. "But currently, we are seeing a little less than normal (flour) runtime between repair work and some fumigations."
That has supported values, he said.
In North Texas, nearby supplies remained tight.
"I've got people looking for (midds) next week," a Texas broker said. "Pastures are drying up and that may be part of the reason business has picked up."
